Package me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.decomposition

Class RecomposedObject<T>

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.decomposition.RecomposedObject<T>
public class RecomposedObject<T> extends Object
A RecomposedObject is used for StorageDecomposers for recomposing multiple paths from the StorageContainer back into the Object that was decomposed by the DecomposedObject. RecomposedObjects will store a path, and a function that returns a CompletableFuture. For example, we may have "x" as a path, and then wait for the data structure to return 125.2 Once all CompletableFutures have completed, the RecomposedObject will return the completed Object.
See Also:
  • to add the Recomposer to the StorageContainers usage list.
  • for decomposing an Object into it's components to read from the data structure.

  • Constructor Details

    • RecomposedObject

      public RecomposedObject(IStorageAPI api)
      Creates an empty RecomposedObject. Generally should not be used, use filled(StorageContainer, Class) instead.
      Parameters:
      api - The IStorageAPI instance.

  • Method Details

    • addRecomposeKey

      public RecomposedObject<T> addRecomposeKey(String path, Class<?> type, Function<String,CompletableFuture<Object>> data)
      Adds a recomposed path and function.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to add to.
      type - The type of Object to retrieve. If this is a list, the type should be the type of list.
      data - The Function, that accepts the path provided and returns a CompletableFuture with the Object retrieved at that path. Generally, you'll want to return StorageContainer.retrieveAsync(String).
      Returns:
      The RecomposedObject instance.

    • addCompletedRecomposeKey

      public RecomposedObject<T> addCompletedRecomposeKey(String path, Function<String,Object> data)
      Adds a completed recomposed path and function.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to add to.
      data - The Function, that accepts the path provided and returns the data to return for this path. Generally, you'll want to return StorageContainer.retrieve(String) or, return an object that isn't from the container.
      Returns:
      The RecomposedObject instance.

    • removeRecomposedKey

      public RecomposedObject<T> removeRecomposedKey(String path)
      Removes a path from the recompose list.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to remove.
      Returns:
      The RecomposedObject instance.

    • onComplete

      public CompletableFuture<T> onComplete(Function<RecomposedObject<T>,T> function)
      Called once all the Recomposed keys are completed. In this method, you should use getCompletedObject(String) on the paths to rebuild your initial Object, and return the Object when completed. Once you return the Function, the CompletableFuture will be completed and the final Object will be returned to the initial retrieve caller.
      Parameters:
      function - A function that accepts this RecomposedObject and returns the completed data Object.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture, that is completed by the user once the Object is rebuilt.

    • complete

      public T complete()
      Calls the onComplete(Function) method.
      Returns:
      The Object that the complete function returns, or null if the Object was unable to be created.

    • getCompletedObject

      public <M> M getCompletedObject(String path)
      Returns the completed object for a specified path. This should only be called in the onComplete(Function) method. This method is Thread blocking, and will wait for the Recompose Functions to be completed to return. This method implicitly cast to the type you're trying to retrieve and may result in ClassCastExceptions.
      Type Parameters:
      M - The implicit type to cast the completed object to.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to get.
      Returns:
      The completed Object once completed by the addRecomposeKey(String, Class, Function).

    • getKeys

      public Set<String> getKeys()
      Returns:
      All the current paths in the recompose map.

    • getRecomposedMap

      public Map<String,Function<String,CompletableFuture<Object>>> getRecomposedMap()
      Returns:
      The entire Recompose map

    • getCompletedPath

      public Map<String,CompletableFuture<Object>> getCompletedPath()
      Returns:
      The completed path map.

    • getPathTypes

      public Map<String,Class<?>> getPathTypes()
      Returns:
      The map that maps each sub-path to a class type.

    • getType

      public Class<?> getType(String path)
      Parameters:
      path - The sub-path to get the type for.
      Returns:
      The Class that this sub-path should be.

    • getAPI

      public IStorageAPI getAPI()
      Returns the IStorageAPI instance that was used to create this Object.
      Returns:
      The IStorageAPI instance.

    • completeObject

      public void completeObject(String path, Object object) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Completes an Object into the Recomposed map as it's been retrieved from the StorageContainer
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the retrieved object.
      object - The object that has been retrieved.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the path is null

    • filled

      public static <T> RecomposedObject<T> filled(StorageContainer container, StorageDecomposer<T> decomposer)
      Creates a RecomposedObject that has all the necessary maps filled for a specific StorageDecomposer.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class of the StorageDecomposer
      Parameters:
      container - The StorageContainer this RecomposedObject is for.
      decomposer - The StorageDecomposer that should be used to fill in the RecomposedObject.
      Returns:
      The RecomposedObject that has its recompose maps built for the provided type.

    • filled

      public static <T> RecomposedObject<T> filled(StorageContainer container, Class<T> classType)
      Creates a RecomposedObject that has all the necessary maps filled for a specific StorageDecomposer.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class of the StorageDecomposer
      Parameters:
      container - The StorageContainer this RecomposedObject is for.
      classType - The type of class that should have it's StorageDecomposer information filled in.
      Returns:
      The RecomposedObject that has its recompose maps built for the provided type.
